title: Trump's emerging surveillance state raises privacy concerns
shortDescription: Civil liberties advocates say the Trump administration's data collection and sharing endanger the Constitutional rights of Americans

title: Can Harvard's alumni save it from Trump?
shortDescription: Harvard has nearly half a million alumni. Could they help cushion the blow from federal funding cuts?

title: From tacos to penguins, Trump finds slogans can sometimes backfire
shortDescription: Trump simplifies complex political debates with punchy slogans but the strategy can also work against him when a critical phrase catches fire.

title: What we know now about Trump’s surveillance push
shortDescription: The Trump administration is expanding government surveillance with Big Tech's help. Here’s what we know now about what’s being tracked.

title: Trump's tariffs are about to enter a new phase: What to know
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is hiking tariffs on aluminum and steel as his administration presses countries to speed up trade talks, amid legal battles.

title: Texas bill would require warning labels on Doritos, more
shortDescription: Foods from Doritos to Froot Loops could be labeled as having ingredients 'not recommended for human consumption' under this Texas bill.

title: Trump lobbies GOP senators as sweeping tax package faces speed bumps
shortDescription: Lawmakers are sprinting to pass the package by July 4, but it won't be easy to overcome concerns about spending and Medicaid impacts.

title: Trump administration eliminates Biden guidance on emergency abortions
shortDescription: The Trump administration on rescinded a Biden policy protecting emergency abortions at hospitals, even in states that have restricted access to abortion.

title: Trump, Vance to attend debut of Les Misérables at Kennedy Center
shortDescription: Some cast members in the Les Misérables production at the Kennedy Center plan to sit out of the show that night.

title: Trump asks Congress to claw back $9.4 billion in DOGE savings
shortDescription: The request is a sliver of the $175 billion Elon Musk's DOGE claims to have cut from the federal government.

title: Musk slams Trump's big tax bill
shortDescription: Days after leaving the White House, Elon Musk slammed President Trump's big tax bill on X.

title: White House confirms deadline for trade deals
shortDescription: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt confirmed the administration has sent a letter to all of its trading partners ahead of a tariff deadline.

title: Top Cuban official accuses Trump admin of escalating tensions
shortDescription: Trump and his top officials have taken a hardline approach to Cuba since he took office in January

title: Trump's DOJ to investigate Biden pardons, use of autopen
shortDescription: Biden pardoned his siblings and their spouses, saying his family had been “subjected to unrelenting attacks and threats."

title: Musk excoriates Trump's big tax bill as a 'disgusting abomination'
shortDescription: Days after leaving the White House, Elon Musk slammed President Trump's big tax bill. "I’m sorry, but I just can’t stand it anymore," Musk said.

title: Linda McMahon grilled by Senate over proposed cuts
shortDescription: Education Secretary Linda McMahon testified to Congress over proposed budget cuts.

title: New Jersey mayor sues Trump aides over arrest at immigration center
shortDescription: Newark Mayor Ras Baraka's lawsuit against Trump officials alleges he was arrested for trespassing without cause and maliciously prosecuted.

title: What NASA missions are on Trump's chopping block? Here's a look
shortDescription: Dozens of NASA's missions to explore the cosmos could be in jeopardy under a budget proposal from the Trump administration.

title: Judge tosses Trump tariff lawsuit but California won't back down
shortDescription: District Judge Jacqueline Corley ruled California should have sued in the Court of International Trade, which has jurisdiction over tariff disputes.

title: Trump lashes out at Sen. Rand Paul over opposition to big tax bill
shortDescription: President Donald Trump ripped Republican Sen. Rand Paul, saying his own constituents 'can't stand him.'
